page.title: 12EDUCATION & SCHOOLS
page.content: There are no schools in this block, the Bishopsbourne school having closed in 1951, and is now a private house. Children of primary/junior age travel to neighbouring villages, Kingston to Barham and Bishopsbourne to Bridge. The Education Authority do not provide free transport for children living within 2 miles of the schools, and so many parents pay for the bus which is provided. In East Kent selection for entrance to Grammar Schools is still made at the age of 11. Grammar Schools (not co-educational) and Secondary Schools, which are mixed, are avail- able in Canterbury. Pupils travel by public transport with free bus passes. Further examinations are taken at 16 (minimum school leaving age) and at 18 for those entering further education or vocational training. A playschool for pre-school children is at Kingston
